result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Craig R. Pilecky

records.addlTxt: of Preliminary Examination

Court calls 22CF77 & 22TR99  @ 9:19 AM Defendant Craig R. Pilecky in court.  Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court for Craig R. Pilecky.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Victim is present in courtroom. Atty Laufenberg makes statement and waives preliminary examination.  Waiver of preliminary examination filed and gone over with def.  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause and binds over. Information filed electronically and copy emailed to Atty. Atty Laufenberg has no objection to proceed with arraignment &  has copy of information, waives reading, reserve rights and enters Not Guilty plea. Court receives Not Guilty plea. Victim makes statement regarding amount on Restitution. Victim makes statement.  Court advise victim to speak with victim coordinator. Court advises defendant to keep address and phone number current with COC & Atty. Court waives defendant appearance for the hearing on the 21st. Traffic case to continue to follow.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Waiver of Prelim on August 23, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on July 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Letter to Judge re Reset JPTC- Routed to JA

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 014117,
Payable Number: 65830,
Amount: $20.00

No presence in establishments with class B liquor license, maintain absolute sobriety, no use of alcohol, no contact with victim one or two or their residence, except one time visit with deputy to retrieve belongings, and no contact with the law enforcement deputy who is a victim, unless officer is acting in course of duty.

01:07 PM Defendant Craig R. Pilecky in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pilecky appears by via Zoom. Attorney Chelsea Payant appears in court for defendant. Def. does not have a copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties. Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Attorney Payant gives statement and waives preliminary hearing. ADA gives statement and a cash bond recommendation of $1,000 with conditions of no presence in establishments with class B liquor license, maintain absolute sobriety, no contact with victim one or two or their residence, and no contact with the law enforcement officer that was involved. Victims are requesting a signature bond. Attorney Payant gives response and requests signature bond. Court gives ruling and orders a cash bond of $200 with conditions of no presence in establishments with class B liquor license, maintain absolute sobriety, no use of alcohol, no contact with victim one or two or their residence, except one time visit with deputy to retrieve belongings, and no contact with the law enforcement deputy who is a victim, unless officer's services are needed. Adjourned Initial Appearance is scheduled 5/23/22 at 11:00pm. Court is adjourned.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
